message: nice
So I've been leaving my groups...
I created a bunch of groups.  And would like to join more active groups.
maybe have a 20 group creation limit, and an unlimited group join limit

@psytek That is, Convore won't become like my Google Reader list where I never get time to read everything due to oversubscription, so a lot of it goes to waste. In this way, it's more like Path's limiting you to 50 friends--pick the things that are most valuable.
sickdood
I am basing this on an issue I had with google code, I was only able to star 20 projects... Its like saying you can only have 20 bookmarks, too limiting...
I star a project if I am interested, its there, its convenient... I can look back at my list later and see what projects I am interested in.
Will require significant investment in mobile experience

I'm actually a fan of the 20 group limit, although that may be a good suggestion (to not count groups one has created toward the 20 group limit). That doesn't necessarily mean that group creation should be unlimited (at least not for free--quick, monetization idea, guys! ;), but you could cap someone to 10 additional group creations or something like that.

@psytek I actually went about it the opposite way. At first I was disappointed that I couldn't just add another group, but I quickly got over that when I realized that I will actually keep up with Convore if I am limited to some extent...
yeah, that makes sense... I guess I shouldn't have grabbed all of the available group names that no one had started yet.
wuzzup
i hate tha 20 group thing
thats pretty good for one day...
its like quora
convore>twitter
I think having a limit on groups goes along with any normal person not being able to jungle an absurd amount of conversations in real life.
@ericflo I'm all for survival of the fittest. And, at the same time, love the idea of allowing tribes to merge.

yeah or do some type of ratio system where you earn points to create more groups sort of like mahalo - I think groups you follow should be unlimited though
Like I was initially overwhelmed by all of the replies, but now that I've gotten the hang of it I'm feeling like i want more action

@psytek Fair point on the projects, but from what I gather on Convore (same as it was with Pownce), the goal isn't so much to read a bunch of stuff, it's to actively dialogue. Personally, I'll have trouble maintaining quality conversation with 20 groups, let alone more.
@michaelschade - well I created a bunch of groups, and now I can only join a few more that I did not create

@psytek Right, and not completely counting group creations toward that cap is definitely something that I think would be worth the Convore team considering (you know, as if I actually know what's a priority for them and what isn't ;).
/me unjoins some groups
We're definitely working on this
Yeah I understand that... If google reader was more like the Convore groups menu it may be easier to manage
it would merge topics, users and URL. The two group owners would have to agree on it, though.
Some background on duplicate groups: before we launched the site we were super worried that nobody would create groups, so we wanted to make it very very easy.
But there are some quick wins we can do soon to make sure less conflicts happen than are happening right now.
A few months
what.
We've got plans for the orphaned groups problem
hey
ikr
conversational stuff that is
@psytek Do you really have the bandwidth to follow 20 projects and contribute a significant amount of attention to all of them at any given moment?

@psytek Although, it would be fair to say that if the reason for the cap is to limit people so that they can actively contribute to the discussion in each, then maybe the group creation *should* count toward that cap. I mean, if you're running the group, one would expect that that would certainly take up as much time as you conversing in other groups.
